intro: Echium echioides, commonly known as the common thimbleweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, thimble-shaped seed pods that contain numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands, meadows, and disturbed areas. Echium echioides is also known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
